alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Peach (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 7:19PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bibb, northeastern Peach and central Crawford Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 719 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was near Sandy Point, or 7 miles east of Roberta, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Macon, Roberta, Byron, Knoxville, Lizella, Lake Tobesofkee, Jack Brown Estates, Skipperton, Rutland, Sandy Point and Horns. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
